intro: Mapouria latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf mapouria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are typically used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
